actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Social Security.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that disability benefits shall not be terminated prior to an exhaustion of administrative remedies unless current medical evidence substantiates such termination.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to prohibit the termination of an individual's disability benefits before a final administrative decision to terminate the individual's entitlement has been made, unless current medical evidence substantiates the change in such individual's medical condition which is the basis for benefit termination.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that disability benefits shall not be terminated prior to an exhaustion of administrative remedies unless current medical evidence substantiates such termination.
